humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 3 x 0x3.5 cm, which is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. This corresponds to T2 staging. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this report is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor size is 3 x 0 x 3.5 cm, which falls in the T2 category (tumors with a size of more than 2 cm and not more than 5 cm) according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for breast cancer.
